text: Amīn al-Dawla ("Trusted Supporter of the Dynasty/State") is an Arabic honorific title. It can refer to: * al-Hasan ibn Ammar (fl. 962–997), Fatimid commander and chief minister * Ibn al-Tilmīdh (1073–1165), Syriac Christian physician and scholar in the Abbasid court * Farrokh Khan (1812–1871), Persian official and ambassador to Napoleon III and Queen Victoria Category:Arabic honorific titles
title: Amin al-Dawla
